item.title: James Ohlen Steps Down from Archetype Entertainment, Remains as Consultant with Wizards of the Coast
item.content:encoded:
A change-up has happened at Archetype Entertainment. The lead of the studio, James Ohlen, will be stepping down from the company, shifting his role within the parent company, Wizards of the Coast.

According to a report by EN World, James Ohlen has chosen to leave his position as the lead of Archetype Entertainment. This is a new internal games studio established by tabletop giant Wizards of the Coast to develop AAA videogames based on original IPs.

This is important since the studio's first project, Exodus, has been long in development. After its 2023 announcement, a lot of pre-rendered trailers, a dedicated episode in the anthology series Secret Level, and an official TTRPG tie-in, the sci-fi title had a gameplay trailer at this year's The Game Awards. The game appears to be a narrative-focused third-person action title. It also dropped a release date of early 2027.

Ohlen's official reasons for his departure from Archetype Entertainment were that he felt that his work on Exodus was complete and that the final bits of development were in good hands. Given the nature of videogame development cycles, this tracks. It means the game is essentially content complete; all that is left is QA, playtesting, and improving technical performance.

But Ohlen is not completely departing from Wizards of the Coast as a company. Ohlen will remain as a creative consultant for the tabletop publisher, shifting his focus to TTRPGs. This is a familiar field for Ohlen since he launched Arcanum Worlds, a TTRPG studio dedicated to publishing third-party material for Dungeons & Dragons.

Better still, Arcanum Worlds' output has a consistent record of quality. Their world includes DMs Guild supplements like Minsc and Boo's Journal of Villainy and Heroes of Baldur's Gate, as well as the comprehensive book on the Nine Hells, Chains of Asmodeus. The studio has also created original fantasy settings built on D&D's system, such as Raiders of the Serpent Sea and Odyssey of the Dragonlords.
